title: Create Textual-backed utility to edit issue
notes: Closed: Implemented dcat edit command with Textual TUI editor

title: Add -e --editor option to dcat create that opens the editor after issue creation
Create Homebrew formula and tap for dogcat
Remove all code related to creating gitattributes files
notes: Closed: Removed all gitattributes-related code: the --no-gitattributes CLI option, the .gitattributes creation logic in init, and all test references.

title: Create homebrew-dogcat tap repository on GitHub
description: Create the oroddlokken/homebrew-dogcat repository on GitHub. This is the Homebrew tap that users will add with 'brew tap oroddlokken/dogcat'. The repo needs a Formula/ directory structure. This is a manual step done on GitHub.

title: Write the Homebrew formula (dogcat.rb)
description: Write Formula/dogcat.rb for the homebrew-dogcat tap. The formula should: (1) clone the dogcat repo from a tagged release, (2) install the source to libexec, (3) create a bin/dcat wrapper script that runs 'uv run --project <libexec> dcat "$@"', (4) depend on uv. The wrapper lets uv handle the Python venv and all dependencies automatically.

title: Tag v0.1.0 release on dogcat repo
description: Create a git tag v0.1.0 on the dogcat repo and push it. The Homebrew formula references a specific tag for the source URL. This ensures users get a stable, versioned snapshot rather than HEAD.

title: Add license to dogcat repo
description: Add a LICENSE file to the dogcat repository. Homebrew formulas require a license field. Pick and add the appropriate license (e.g. MIT). This needs to be done before the formula can be finalized.

title: Add install instructions to README
description: Update the dogcat README with Homebrew installation instructions: 'brew tap oroddlokken/dogcat && brew install dogcat'. Include any prerequisites (uv gets installed automatically as a dependency).

title: dcat shows a list of unsorted commands
notes: Closed: Fixed by adding SortedGroup class to sort CLI commands alphabetically

title: Support external .dogcats directory via .dogcatrc config file
description: Allow users to place their .dogcats folder outside the repo by creating a .dogcatrc file in the repo root (or any parent directory). The file contains a single path pointing to the .dogcats directory. Supports relative and absolute paths. Discovery uses the same upward search pattern: look for .dogcatrc first, read the path from it, then fall back to searching for .dogcats/ directly.

title: Add .dogcatrc file parsing
description: Create a function to parse .dogcatrc files. The file contains a single line: the path to the .dogcats directory. Support both absolute and relative paths (relative to the .dogcatrc file location). Add this to config.py or a new module as appropriate.

title: Update find_dogcats_dir() to check .dogcatrc first
description: Modify find_dogcats_dir() in cli.py to first search upward for a .dogcatrc file. If found, read the directory path from it and resolve it (handling relative paths relative to the .dogcatrc location). If no .dogcatrc is found, fall back to the current behavior of searching for a .dogcats/ directory.

title: Add dcat init support for .dogcatrc
description: Extend dcat init to optionally create a .dogcatrc file pointing to a custom directory. For example: dcat init --dir /path/to/external/.dogcats. When --dir is provided, create the .dogcatrc file in the current directory and initialize .dogcats at the specified path.

title: Write tests for .dogcatrc discovery and parsing
description: Test cases: 1) .dogcatrc with absolute path, 2) .dogcatrc with relative path, 3) .dogcatrc in parent directory, 4) no .dogcatrc falls back to .dogcats/ search, 5) .dogcatrc pointing to nonexistent directory gives clear error, 6) .dogcatrc with empty/invalid content gives clear error.

title: Add .dogcatrc documentation to dcat prime output
description: Update the prime/help output to mention .dogcatrc as a way to configure an external .dogcats directory. Include a brief example.

title: Add pyfzf issue picker when edit is called with no arguments
description: When 'dcat edit' is invoked with no arguments, open a pyfzf prompt where the user can search and select from the issue list (same list as 'dcat list'). After selecting an issue, open it in the editor.

title: dcat new opens an interactive prompt to create an issue with Textual, similar to dcat edit
description: Add a 'dcat new' command that opens an interactive Textual-based prompt for creating a new issue, reusing the same UI patterns as 'dcat edit'.

title: Add collapsible fields for notes, acceptance criteria, and design to edit form, and make the application scrollable
description:
In the Textual edit form, add collapsible sections for notes, acceptance criteria, and design fields. Also make the application scrollable so all fields are accessible when the form is longer than the terminal height.

See https://textual.textualize.io/widgets/collapsible/ for documentation

title: Show closed parent issues in tree view when they have visible children
description: In --tree mode, closed parent issues should still be displayed when they have open/visible children. This preserves the organizational hierarchy context. In flat list mode, keep current behavior (closed parents hidden by default). The closed parent is already visually distinguished by the ✓ status icon.
notes: Closed: Implemented: closed parents now shown in --tree mode when they have visible children. Flat list behavior unchanged.

title: Add 'dcat in-progress' command to show issues currently in progress
notes: Closed: Added dcat in-progress command with tests

title: Show closed date in brief issue format for closed issues
notes: Closed: Closed issues now display [closed yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM] in brief format.

title: Reorder fields in dcat show: Created before Closed, closed reason next to Closed date
notes: Closed: Reordered fields: newlines after title/type, description moved to bottom, Created before Closed with reason inline, human-readable date format, parent title shown

title: Color metadata tags in dcat list --tree output
description: The [closed ...] and [parent: ...] metadata tags in dcat list --tree are currently plain uncolored text. Color them dim/grey (bright_black) so the important parts (priority, title, type) stand out more while metadata stays visible but subdued.
notes: Closed: Styled [parent: ...] and [closed ...] metadata tags with bright_black (dim grey) in format_issue_brief

title: Add a git integration guide command
description: Add a new dcat command (e.g. dcat git) that explains how to use dogcat with git. Should cover things like: committing .dogcats changes, branching workflows, resolving merge conflicts in issues.jsonl, how to .gitignore the .dogcats directory if needed, and any best practices for integrating dogcat into a git-based workflow.
notes: Closed: Added dcat git command with integration guide

title: Rename skip_agent feature to no_agent for clarity
description:
The current naming is confusing:
- skip_agent: true metadata key is unclear
- --exclude-skip-agent CLI flag is a double-negative

Rename to:
- Metadata: no_agent: true
- Create/update flag: --no-agent (remove with --agent)
- List/ready filter: --agent-only

Files to update:
- src/dogcat/cli.py — CLI flags and filtering logic
- tests/test_dogcat_cli.py — update test names and assertions
- tests/test_models.py — update metadata key references
notes: Closed: Renamed skip_agent to no_agent, --exclude-skip-agent to --agent-only, --no-skip-agent to --agent

title: Update CLAUDE.md to use --agent-only flag
description: Update CLAUDE.md to instruct agents to use --agent-only when listing issues, so that issues marked with --no-agent are automatically excluded from agent workflows.
notes: Closed: Updated CLAUDE.md to use --agent-only flag

title: What happens if archived issues' IDs collide with new issues?
description: If issues are archived and then a new issue is created that gets assigned the same ID as a previously archived issue, what happens? Is there a collision/conflict? Does the system guard against this?

title: Demo command should use current folder name as namespace instead of hardcoded 'demo'
description: The demo command in demo.py hardcodes IDGenerator(prefix="demo") (line 47), whereas the normal create command in cli.py resolves the namespace from the project config via get_issue_prefix(dogcats_dir) (line 693). The demo command should derive the namespace from the current folder name (or project config) so that generated demo issue IDs match the project's namespace convention.
